present.english: I pay for the expensive bill
The rich customer pays for the expensive food
The kind brothers pay for the new clothes

imperfect.english: I was paying for the expensive bill
The rich customer was paying for the expensive food
The kind brothers were paying for the new clothes

future.english: I will pay for the expensive bill
The rich customer will pay for the expensive food
The kind brothers will pay for the new clothes

aorist.english: I paid for the expensive bill
The rich customer paid for the expensive food
The kind brothers paid for the new clothes

optative.english: I should pay for the expensive bill

optative.georgian: მდიდარმა მომხმარებელმა ძვირი საჭმელი უნდა გადაიხადოს
optative.english: The rich customer should pay for the expensive food

optative.georgian: კეთილმა ძმებმა ახალი ტანსაცმელი უნდა გადაიხადონ
optative.english: The kind brothers should pay for the new clothes

imperative.english: You, pay for the monthly rent
You all (you formal), pay for the good service
